Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that refugees in Malaysia are resisting COVID-19 tests, without providing sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that refugees in Malaysia are resisting COVID-19 tests.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement issued by UNHCR officials in Malaysia, who refuted the claim and called it "FAKE".
Exist alternative explanation: The UNHCR spokesperson stated that refugees and asylum-seekers who attended the Sri Petaling event were cooperating with health officials, suggesting that there may be an alternative explanation for any perceived resistance to COVID-19 tests.
